title: Mexican team have three players sent off in 30 seconds as cup game descends into chaos
text:
Sport Mexican team have three players sent off in 30 seconds as cup game descends into chaos The last-16 clash between Toluca and Morelia was level at 2-2 with five minutes remaining when it all kicked-off Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Three players sent off in 30 seconds Share this video Get football   
A Mexican cup game spiralled out control when the referee sent three players off from the same side in 30 seconds. 
Toluca and Morelia were level at 2-2 with just five minutes of normal time remaining of their Copa MX last-16 clash when the home side lost their heads. 
Midfielder Jesus Mendez got the ball rolling when he was issued with a second yellow card and was sent to the dressing room. 
That didn't sit well with his team-mates who made a beeline for the referee to protest the decision. One: Mendez gets a second yellow for a poor tackle Two: Goalkeeper Talavera goes Three: Triverio is a goner 
Video-replay experiment can "remove many scars from referees' backs" as it exposes cheats, thugs â€” and howlers 
Goalkeeper Alfredo Talavera arrived on the scene and was given a second yellow of his own for descent before Enrique Triverio steamed in and shoved the referee who immediately whipped out a straight red. 
Eight-man Toluca were able to hang on until the end of the match and force a penalty shootout. 
But their poor discipline cost them in the shootout, as they missed their first three spot kicks, while Morelia netted theirs to progress into the last eight. poll loading Did all three deserve to go? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
